text: "Boa Constrictor" is a song written by Shel Silverstein and originally featured on his 1962 album Inside Folk Songs. == Johnny Cash version == The song was covered by Johnny Cash for his 1966 comedy album Everybody Loves a Nut. Released as the third single from the album (Columbia 4-43763, with a non-album track "Bottom of a Mountain" on the opposite side), the song reached number 39 on the U.S. Billboard country chart. and number 33 on the Cash Box country chart. In January 1967 the song was re- released as a single with "The One on the Right Is on the Left" on the other side. === Lyrical analysis and background === == Track listings == == Charts == {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="center"|Chart (1966) !align="center"|Peak position |- |- |} == References == == External links == * "Boa Constrictor" on the Johnny Cash official website Category:Shel Silverstein songs Category:Johnny Cash songs Category:1966 singles Category:Columbia Records singles Category:1962 songs Category:Songs written by Shel Silverstein Category:Novelty songs Category:Country music songs Category:Peter, Paul and Mary songs
title: Boa Constrictor (song)
